sections.body: All oracles are cursed to some degree, but some oracles bear an even heavier burden. Though doubly afflicted with supernatural or physical hindrances, a dual-cursed oracle can manipulate fortune and gains greater insights into her mystery.
sections.name: Dual-Cursed Oracle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Dual-Cursed Oracle

sections.body: Any.
sections.name: Recommended Mysteries

sections.body: A dual-cursed oracle must choose two curses at 1st level. One of these curses (oracle's choice) never changes its abilities as the oracle gains levels; for example, an oracle with clouded vision never gains darkvision 60 feet, blindsense, or blindsight. The other curse comes with its normal benefits.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Dual-Cursed Oracle/Oracles Curse
sections.name: Oracle's Curse

sections.body: A dual-cursed oracle gains no additional class skills from her mystery.
sections.name: Class Skills

sections.body: ill omen (2nd), oracle's burden (4th), bestow curse (6th). These bonus spells replace the oracle's mystery bonus spells at these levels.
sections.name: Bonus Spells

sections.body: A dual-cursed oracle gains a new revelation at 5th level and 13th level. These are in addition to the normal revelations she receives at 3rd level, 7th level, and so on. In addition, the cursed oracle may select the following revelations in place of a mystery revelation.

At 1st level, as an immediate action, you can force a creature within 30 feet to reroll any one d20 roll that it has just made before the results of the roll are revealed. The creature must take the result of the reroll, even if it's worse than the original roll. Once a creature has suffered from your misfortune, it cannot be the target of this revelation again for 1 day.
sections.name: Misfortune
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Dual-Cursed Oracle/Revelations/Misfortune

sections.body: At 5th level, as an immediate action, you can reroll any one d20 roll that you have just made before the results of the roll are revealed. You must take the result of the reroll, even if it's worse than the original roll. You can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every six oracle levels beyond 5th.
sections.name: Fortune
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Dual-Cursed Oracle/Revelations/Fortune

sections.name: Revelations

sections.body: The enlightened philosopher seeks enlightenment through compassion, moderation, and humility. By following her philosophy's teachings, the enlightened philosopher seeks to reach enlightenment and become one with the universe.
sections.name: Enlightened Philosopher
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Enlightened Philosopher

sections.body: Any lawful.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Enlightened Philosopher/Alignment
sections.name: Alignment

sections.body: ancestor, fire, heavens, lore, metal, nature, stone, time, waves, wood.
sections.name: Recommended Mysteries

sections.body: An enlightened philosopher adds Linguistics and all Knowledge skills to her list of class skills. These replace the additional class skills from her mystery.
sections.name: Class Skills

sections.body: owl's wisdom (4th), water walk (6th), discern lies (8th), true seeing (10th), wind walk (12th), ethereal jaunt (14th), moment of prescience (16th), astral projection (18th). These bonus spells replace the oracle's mystery bonus spells at these levels.
sections.name: Bonus Spells

sections.body: An enlightened philosopher must take the following revelation at 7th level.
As the lore mystery revelation.
sections.name: Mental Acuity
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Enlightened Philosopher/Revelations/Mental Acuity

sections.name: Revelations

sections.body: Upon achieving 20th level, you achieve true enlightenment and become one with the universe. You receive a bonus on all saving throws equal to your Charisma modifier. You become immune to confusion, exhaustion, fatigue, nausea, and sickened effects. You can take 20 on all Knowledge skill checks. Should you die, you are reborn 3 days later as a living example of the summoning of your chosen philosophy (treat as the reincarnate spell). This replaces the final revelation of the oracle's mystery.
sections.name: Final Revelation

sections.body: A planar oracle has an affinity with one of the Outer Planes. She is at home on the multiple planes of the Great Beyond, and can eventually become an outsider herself.
sections.name: Planar Oracle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Planar Oracle

sections.body: dark tapestry, flame, heavens, stone, waves, wind.
sections.name: Recommended Mysteries

sections.body: endure elements (2nd), elemental speech (4th), tongues (6th), planar adaptation (8th), plane shift (10th), mass planar adaptation (12th), shadow walk (14th), etherealness (16th), gate (18th). These bonus spells replace the oracle's mystery bonus spells at these levels.
sections.name: Bonus Spells

sections.body: At 1st level, you must choose one Outer Plane with which you have an affinity. This choice cannot be changed. A planar oracle must take the following revelation at 3rd level.
At 3rd level, you gain energy resistance 10 against one energy type associated with your chosen plane. At 11th level, your energy resistance increases to 20.
sections.name: Planar Resistance
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Planar Oracle/Revelations/Planar Resistance

sections.name: Revelations

sections.body: At 20th level, you become an extraplanar creature. Choose one outer plane, such as Heaven or the Abyss. You gain superficial physical characteristics as appropriate to natives of your chosen outer plane. For example, if your chosen plane is Heaven, you gain angelic features such as a halo and metallic skin. This change does not alter your Hit Dice, hit points, saving throws, skill points, class skills, or proficiencies. Your type changes to “outsider (extraplanar),” except on your associated plane, where your type is “outsider (native).” In addition, you gain immunity to your associated energy type and gain damage reduction 10/magic. Unlike other outsiders, you can still be brought back from the dead as if you were a member of your previous creature type. This replaces the final revelation of the oracle's mystery.
sections.name: Final Revelation

sections.body: Some oracles are possessed by spirits, demons, or similar beings. Instead of the possessed oracle drawing her powers from deities, these otherworldly forces work their magic through her.
sections.name: Possessed Oracle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Possessed Oracle

sections.body: Any.
sections.name: Recommended Mysteries

sections.body: A possessed oracle must choose the haunted or tongues curse at 1st level.
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Possessed Oracle/Oracles Curse
sections.name: Oracle's Curse

sections.body: ventriloquism (1st), spider climb (4th), screech (6th), sleepwalk (8th), telekinesis (10th), animate objects (12th), divine vessel (16th). These bonus spells replace the oracle's normal mystery bonus spells at these levels.
sections.name: Bonus Spells

sections.body: A possessed oracle must take the following revelation at 1st level.

You gain a +2 bonus on Will saves against enchantment spells or effects. At 7th level, you may reroll a failed Will save once per day as an immediate action. You must take the second result, even if it is worse.
sections.name: Two Minds
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Possessed Oracle/Revelations/Two Minds

sections.name: Revelations

sections.body: While all oracles possess some ability at divination, the seer is a true prophet, able to see things as they really are, or will be.
sections.name: Seer

sections.body: lore, nature, time.
sections.name: Recommended Mysteries

sections.body: detect thoughts (4th), clairaudience/clairvoyance (6th), scrying (8th), true seeing (10th), legend lore (12th), greater scrying (14th), vision (16th), foresight (18th). These bonus spells replace the oracle's mystery bonus spells at these levels.
sections.name: Bonus Spells

sections.body: A seer must take the following revelations at the listed levels.
As the nature mystery revelation. You must take this revelation at 1st level.
sections.name: Natural Divination
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Seer/Revelations/Natural Divination

sections.body: Once per day, you can enter a trance to gain a glimpse of the future. This trance lasts for 1 minute, which must be uninterrupted and during which you can take no other actions. At 3rd level, you gain the benefits of an augury spell with 90% effectiveness. At 5th level, you gain the benefits of a divination spell with 90% effectiveness. At 9th level, the knowledge you gain is equivalent to a commune spell. None of these spell effects require material components. You must take this revelation at 3rd level.
sections.name: Gift of Prophecy
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Seer/Revelations/Gift of Prophecy

sections.name: Revelations

sections.body: Some oracles seek meaning in the pattern of the stars across the night sky, the trails of comets, and the eternal orbits of the planets.
sections.name: Stargazer

sections.body: dark tapestry, heavens, lore, nature, time.
sections.name: Recommended Mysteries

sections.body: A stargazer adds Knowledge (nature), Perception, and Survival to her list of class skills. These replace the additional class skills from her mystery.
sections.name: Class Skills

sections.body: faerie fire (2nd), glitterdust (4th), guiding star (6th), wandering star motes (8th), meteor swarm (18th). These bonus spells replace the oracle's mystery bonus spells at these levels.
sections.name: Bonus Spells

sections.body: A stargazer must take the following revelations at the listed levels.
As the heavens mystery revelation. You must take this revelation at 1st level.
sections.name: Guiding Star
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Stargazer/Revelations/Guiding Star

sections.body: As the heavens mystery revelation. You must take this revelation at 7th level.
sections.name: Star Chart
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Magic/Rules/Spellcasting Class Options/Oracle/Oracle Archetypes/Stargazer/Revelations/Star Chart
